article.description: Fairleigh Dickinson knocks off LIU Brooklyn 89-67
article.headline: Fairleigh Dickinson knocks off LIU Brooklyn 89-67
article.linkText: Fairleigh Dickinson knocks off LIU Brooklyn 89-67
article.story: BROOKLYN, N.Y. -- Mathias Seilund scored a career-high 20 points on 9-of-11 shooting and Matt MacDonald scored 19 as Fairleigh Dickinson broke an 11-game losing streak against LIU Brooklyn with an 89-67 victory on Thursday night. The Knights (6-11, 2-1 Northeast) hadn't defeated the Blackbirds (5-11, 0-3) since Jan. 20, 2007. Mustafaa Jones added 13 points and Jayde Dawson 11 for the Knights, who also received a career-high 13 assists from Sidney Sanders Jr, whose game total is the second-best in program history. The Knights hit 13 of 30 3-point attempts for 43.3 percent. FDU scored 20 points off turnovers while committing a program-low four of their own. Three Blackbirds scored 12 points each: Troy Joseph, E.J. Reed and Iverson Fleming. The loss was the third in a row for LIU. FDU led from 9:29 of the first half, building its biggest lead of 27 points, 76-49, with 8 minutes left.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
